    • Method Detail

      • getCookieManager

        public static CookieManager getCookieManager()

      • sslOkHttpClient

        public static okhttp3.OkHttpClient sslOkHttpClient(@Nullable
                                                   KeyStore devTrustStore,
                                                   List<HttpCookie> cookies)
        Creates a OkHttpClient to start a TLS connection.
        Parameters:
        devTrustStore - if not null, uses the provided TrustStore instead of whatever is configured in the JVM. This is a convenient way to allow developers to start playing with Keywhiz right away. This option should not be used in production systems.
        cookies - list of cookies to include in the client.
        Returns:
        new http client.

      • saveCookies

        public static void saveCookies(CookieManager cookieManager,
                               Path path)
        Serialize the cookies to JSON from the given CookieManager to a file at the specified path. Output file will have 660 permissions (owner-read, owner-write).
        Parameters:
        cookieManager - CookieManager that contains cookies to be serialized.
        path - Location to serialize cookies to file.

      • saveCookies

        public static void saveCookies(Path path)

      • loadCookies

        public static List<HttpCookie> loadCookies(Path path)
                                    throws IOException
        Load cookies from the specified file from JSON to a name to value mapping.
        Parameters:
        path - Location of serialized cookies to load.
        Returns:
        list of cookies that were read
        Throws:
        IOException

      • readPassword

        public static char[] readPassword(String user)
        Read password from console. Note that when the System.console() is null, there is no secure way of entering a password without exposing it in the clear on the console (it is echoed onto the screen). For this reason, it is suggested that the user login prior to using functionality such as input redirection since this could result in a null console.
        Parameters:
        user - who we are prompting a password for
        Returns:
        user-inputted password
